entry.title: Ninenzaka Evening (東山花灯路)
entry.content:
Went to Higashiyama near Kiyomizu Temple for their spring Hanatouro evening lightup (you can see all the small lights on the ground). Really crowded, as it usually is during the day.

I tried a five minute long exposure, but there are still ghosts of all the people that went by. But the guard on the right did not move at all!

entry.title: Plum Blossoms
entry.content:
Went to Kitano Tenmangu Shrine (北野天満宮) in northern Kyoto for their beautiful display of plum blossoms this morning.

A sprinkle of snow(!) was falling as I left the house, but when I got to the shrine the sun came out for a while.

They look like cherry blossoms, but after some research I was able to confirm that these are white plum blossoms. Most cherry blossoms are still about 10-15 days out according to the web sites that obsessively cover the bloom as it moves across Japan during the next six weeks.
